title: Lesbian Pop Musical Satire 'Queens of Drama' Fun & Sparkly Trailer
description: "This is my heart, it's yours... forever." Altered Innocence has unveiled the US trailer for a wild & sparkly French pop musical film titled Queens of Drama, marking the feature debut of filmmaker Alexis Langlois, known for his splashy music videos. This initiailly premiered at the 2024 Cannes Film Festival last year in the Critics' Week (Semaine de la Critique) sidebar section. Pop diva Mimi Madamour's career peaks in 2005 before spiraling downwards due to her tumultuous love affair with punk icon Billie Kohler, their passionate and rage-fueled relationship playing out on stage for half a century. Featuring an iconic cast, including Asia Argento and Alma Jodorowsky, and containing hit songs like "Don't Touch" by Yelle and "Fisted to the Heart", this film vividly dissects the turbulence of toxic relationships—whether between fans and their idols or within passionate queer love affairs. "This is my heart, it's yours... forever." Altered Innocence has unveiled the US trailer for a wild & sparkly French pop musical film titled Queens of Drama, marking the feature debut of filmmaker Alexis Langlois, known for his splashy music videos. This initiailly premiered at the 2024 Cannes Film Festival last year in the Critics' Week (Semaine de la Critique) sidebar section. Pop diva Mimi Madamour's career peaks in 2005 before spiraling downwards due to her tumultuous love affair with punk icon Billie Kohler, their passionate and rage-fueled relationship playing out on stage for half a century. Featuring an iconic cast, including Asia Argento and Alma Jodorowsky, and containing hit songs like "Don't Touch" by Yelle and "Fisted to the Heart", this film vividly dissects the turbulence of toxic relationships—whether between fans and their idols or within passionate queer love affairs. Starring Louiza Aura as Mimi Madamour, Gio Ventura, Bilal Hassani (France's Eurovision Song Contest singer in 2019), Alma Jodorowsky, Nana Benamer, Asia Argento, Thomas Poitevin, Dustin Muchuvitz, and Raya Martigny. With music by Rebeka Warrior, Yelle, Mona Soyoc, Pierre Desprats. This looks like a music video turned into a 114 minute movie! Have fun.

Here's the official US trailer (+ poster) for Alexis Langlois' musical Queens of Drama, from YouTube:

An outrageous lesbian pop musical satire inspired by the pop frenzy of the early 2000s, Queens of Drama charts the rise and fall of new star Mimi Madamour and her passionate, rage-fueled love affair with punk icon Billie Kohler. Over the course of half a century we follow these drama queens as they top the charts and set sail on the course of mad queer love. Director Alexis Langlois brings trademark glittercore pop-punk aesthetic to create a vibrant, unforgettable spectacle of music and passion. Queens of Drama, also known as Les Reines du Drame in French, is directed by French indie filmmaker Alexis Langlois, making his feature directorial debut after many short films & music videos previously. The screenplay is written by Alexis Langlois, Carlotta Coco, Thomas Colineau. Produced by Inès Daien Dasi and Benoit Rolland. This initially premiered at the 2024 Cannes Film Festival last year playing in the Critics' Week sidebar. It already opened in France last fall. Altered Innocence debuts Langlois' Queens of Drama film in select US theaters (exclusively at Alamo Drafthouse locations) starting on April 18th, 2025 this spring. So who's intrigued?
